summary: This document is an email chain from August 25-26, 2019, regarding the booking and cost of airfare for eight individuals traveling to New York City (NYC) for the 'Epstein Case'. It details flight itineraries and costs from various US cities and Barcelona, Spain, totaling approximately $8,000, and requests missing hotel reservations.

events.title: Travel Arrangements for Epstein Case
events.description: Airfare is booked for eight individuals from various locations (West Palm Beach, Los Angeles, Fort Lauderdale, Dayton, Las Vegas, Washington DC/Seattle, and Barcelona, Spain) to travel to New York City, presumably in connection with the Epstein case.

keyFacts: On August 26, 2019, airfare was arranged for eight people to travel to New York City for the 'Epstein Case'.
The total approximate cost for the airfare was $8,000.
Travel originated from multiple US cities and Barcelona, Spain, indicating witnesses or associates were being gathered from a wide geographic area.
The email specifically requests hotel reservations, indicating coordinated travel and lodging for case-related purposes.
The document is internal government correspondence, likely from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS), concerning fact witness travel logistics.
